info.name: Descending motor tracts
info.description: These descending motor tracts originate in the cerebral cortex and then travel through the posterior limb of the internal capsule, the cerebral crus of the midbrain, the basal portion of the pons and the pyramids of the medulla.  Sometimes this group of tracts is referred to as the pyramidal tract or system.  It includes the corticospinal, corticobulbar and corticopontine tracts.
